lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone! Close. Welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons, rolling dice and shit. So welcome! Always awkward. Anyway, before we get into the game, we're going to do some quick announcements for the evening. First off, we had our recent 100th episode, and I think we have some merch in there. Laura, any updates?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The signed versions are going to be in the store for one more week, and the non-signed version is going to be in the store for two more weeks! And that's it, and then they're gone forever. So tell your friends, tell your buddies, tell everyone you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hide your neighbors, hide your wife.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. And we also have our Scanlan concert tees and our Slayer's Cake aprons. Our hats are out of stock, but everything else should be in there if you guys want to go check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fantastic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the shop at Geekandsundry.com.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, you're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wednesday Club? Mr. Taliesin Jaffe?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we've got something special planned, but I don't know if it's official yet, but I think that we are going to be celebrating Pride Month, and we may have a special guest. I can't say for sure, but we're going to be talking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Stan Lee.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's Stan Lee. He's coming out on our show.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You heard it here first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He and his pansexual adventures throughout comicdom. Excelsior. It's going to be fun. It'll be a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go watch it, true believers!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possible special guest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Taliesin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why limit myself to just one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's Gilbert Gottfried?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Also, we have Talks Machina Tuesdays at seven PM Pacific time here, on Twitch and Alpha, to discuss what you'll watch tonight on this episode.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Getting turnt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that. Thank you, Sam. That's okay. Well done.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really pleasing in the hand, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what she said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And I think that's it. Quick announcements this evening. Nice and quick. I like it. That means we get to dive back into the story here, guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should we mention that we had to reprint some character sheets, or are we not mentioning that? I've now said it online.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah! A few characters levelled. We have a few folks at 18 now, so that's fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Old enough to get in trouble for drinking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to make a special announcement?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a time jump in Blindspot, so I'm here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spoiler!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they just assume your character doesn't go to the salon and cut your hair? Is that not a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But they're so pretty!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love them. So much hair!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did your character in the time jump go to the Feywild, or go sailing on the sea?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome back. So last we left off--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, do I put that on my saving throws, too?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to share it with the world. Laura just leveled up, and her attack bonus went down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because I was doing it wrong this whole time. Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Vox Machina, what do you do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Figuring it all out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taking five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Time out, time out, time out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just hanging out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we found out that there's a ritual happening soon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, like super stat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And there's no day or night here, so who cares, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? It's all just night, all the time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's kind of a sunless gray sky. There's some low light, like a very heavy-- Like a very dark, thunderous Seattle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) Hello Seattle! It's a song.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What song?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is now. So.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're also vampire creatures!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we look like the gloom stalkers! No, those are the flying ones.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We look like miscellaneous vampirey things, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, shambling zombies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scary ghouly creatures.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Extras from a bad zombie video.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Pass Without a Trace still kicking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say probably because you haven't cast a spell yet that would've interrupted it, it would be...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast it when we landed here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But I don't think you've done anything that altered that concentration yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so. So it's still going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think so. For maybe another 30 minutes or so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I didn't Hunter's Mark either of the guys that I attacked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we've got the smoking thing, right? What's it called, the censer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The smoky thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The censer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it called a censer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First try!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we learned that it does something, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It protects you from ghouley deads.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From ghouley deads, specifically.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Will it protect all of us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's got a range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we stay in this... tight.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If we stay tight?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stay tight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So why don't we just walk through the center of town, in the middle of the road, with the censer, and walk into the tower? No? Maybe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. I see nothing wrong with this plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fly up to the top of the tower?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stay on the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Teleport somewhere?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have that ability?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no trees on the top of the tower.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or we can be smoky mist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then it'll take us a minute to not be mist anymore, and by then they'll realize we're there on the top of the tower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we take off the robes that they had and pop it on some of us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, why not? I mean, we're undead. We look like we're undead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think they probably know we're here. I think they probably know we're coming. I think let's just trepidatiously make our way a little closer, see what else is in this town, see if maybe there's anything useful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And stay low-key. We don't need to go marching.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Blend in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's not blow anything up yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we're making our way to the tower.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Making our way towards the tower, in a towerly direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we at full health?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. I'm not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not either.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can help with that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we take a 30-minute rest and roll some hit points?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we fight? Oh, no, that's right, we went down going through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, going through the actual portal, the spinning ball of death caused some damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if there's actually time for that, though, to take.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm all right with mine. I'm 20 points down. I don't mind being 20 points down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's be all full, though. We can be full.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to fucking potentially fight Delilah Briarwood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's be full.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming it's going to take us some time just to even get there, though, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it considered healing as we walk there, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you have to take a rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get a little closer, then, and survey the situation, and then take a break. I feel like we're a bit far.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just don't know if there's time. If she's already started a ritual.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we run into something on the way there, though, I don't want to be at peak performance yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's move.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, God.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we still have Pass Without a Trace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. For the next 30 minutes or so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So let's take advantage of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's at least move for 30 more minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's got the censer in the front? Because we've got to stay together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone in a robe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Who's in a robe? We're all undead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are me and you in robes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can do robes. I'm all right with robes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's only three of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a robe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take a robe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You lead with the censer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a robe with the censer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Percy and Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You both throw robes on over your Seeming-altered undead bodies. Percy, you're carrying the censer?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, I'm carrying the censer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you're all slowly clustered behind them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (chanting)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (chanting)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys continue moving, what's very plainly towards the center of the city as the tower stands as this giant beacon of shadow in the center of the horizon. The streets are scattered and broken. You can see there was, what may have seemed almost like a hint of cobblestone at one point, really just looks like largely broken and shattered badlands and dried stone that seems to have been pummeled by impacts of some kind, cracked into small pieces. This is a city by function and function alone. There was very little considered in the beauty of its construction, at least this far out. As you continue to press towards the center of the city--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to keep an eye out, just to see if anybody's noticing. If it seems like people are paying attention to us in a way that they shouldn't be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Well, as you're keeping an eye out, I would like all of you guys to make a deception roll, with advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Gil.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Too big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sound of your rendition, that song. As you're walking, a shadow seems to cross, a large hulking shadow crosses past one of the roads and turns and begins walking your direction. And you see ahead what looks to be about a ten foot tall, thick, burly figure of brownish red flesh, torn, and chains and hooks hanging from it. It looks to be almost like an amalgam of large hobgoblin body parts that have been sewn and stitched together with spikes and iron plates, jutting through, keeping it together at the seams. Where there would be a face, you see instead a giant metal mass that looks like a cage of some kind, and behind it these two glowing beads of yellow eyes poking through, and you watch as it just walks in a straight line (impacts).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Coming right for us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Walking in your direction. Its arms are curled in front of it like a gorilla, its fingers dragging in the dust below it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it look like it's just happening in our direction, or is it coming toward us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. It's about 60 feet up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a road we can turn directions?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a nonchalant way of maintaining direction but getting out of its way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There would be enough space to give about a ten foot berth to it as you put your back against the side of one of the nearest buildings and let it pass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like parting for the queen at the Ren Faire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little bit, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or Taliesin Jaffe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or Taliesin Jaffe at any party.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I move to the side and put my head down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's our ploy if this thing tries to kill us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kill it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Same old same old.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (heavy footsteps) You guys all make your way to the side and you watch. It's autonomous, it's not being brought along with anybody. It's running a path down the road. You all move off to the side, and as you maneuver to the side of it, it gets close to the censer you're carrying, and it (groaning) puts its fingers out of the way, actually crushing some of the stonework on one of the nearby buildings to pull itself aside, trying to avoid the billowing of the smoke from the censer. It gives a dull, deep resonant (huff) in your direction as it passes, and then eventually passes by the cluster of you that have all moved to the side, after its head shifts and scans back in the path that it's walking and it moves past you, following the direction you just came from.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Way to be Fonzies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice. Very nice. So cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. This thing works.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lot of Fonzies. Smells terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue further into the city. You still hear the distant, low shrieks of the gloom stalkers (shriek) overhead, swooping past in clusters, circling around. Occasionally you watch one or two swoop down and land on a distant rooftop, and you hear the crunching of heavy stone and whatever materials were still remaining on the roof of that structure as it lands and surveys a bit, and then (whoosh) takes off and joins the rest of its kin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do any of the buildings look remarkable or interesting? I'm trying to keep an eye out for any building that may have anything inside it of vague importance. Either the building itself is slightly more interesting, or it looks like maybe someone has boarded something up to try and maintain some kind of vigil against the darkness? I'm not entirely sure. Out of the ordinary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of these buildings are hard to tell apart when they're all just in this state of disrepair and destruction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some of them have doors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of them do. Some of them have windows, kind of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Holes where windows might be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Possibly. Some, you can't tell if it's a hole, or a window. Or a door? As you press forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I felt Orthax take over again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So this is Osgiliath, right? It's wrecked ruin, no complete buildings, or are any of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's been little intent to reconstruct from this point. Like I said, you're still probably a good mile and a half out from the center of the city, and as you walk further in, you can see more clusters of skeletons traveling in groups of 12 to 15, somewhat erratically. You've seen some creatures that seem to walk with an intent pattern, like they have some sort of a sentinel path that they follow to keep watch on the perimeter or the roads of the city. The skeletons that wander, the undead that you see clattering about across the dusty, cracked grounds between the buildings, are erratic, uncontrolled. Mostly it seems to be less intentionally created undead, and more just risen by the nature of the plane you walk, and haven't bothered anyone yet, or at least those who live here. As you begin walking forward, you watch as a cluster of them spills into this T intersection a little ways up, a few of them falling and tumbling and getting back up (cracking). As they cluster together, some of them bang into each other. You hear the clattering of metal from the bits of armor that still cling to their long-rotted forms. Broken bones, some of them are missing arms, or sections of a skull is exposed and cracked open on the side, where you can see what looks to be some sort of long-dried and rotted away gray matter was left to slowly collapse like a flan in a cupboard. As you begin to approach that area, they separate a bit and scatter to fill, almost diffusing in the center of this intersection, and then they contract, almost like there's a strange hive mind magic that seems to draw them back together. They're just moving in these autonomous clusters of chaos. You see on them still, similar to the ones you noticed earlier, some of the armor that they're wearing appears to be reminiscent to the armor that the black guard that you battled at the ziggurat earlier had, or similar dark metal, and others have long-destroyed, ruined, scraped and scarred bits of silver and gold armor that are emblazoned with long-ruined and defaced symbols of the Dawn Father, Pelor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it seem like both of those factions are still-- are they clustered in the same groups?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are. And you get the sense that whatever battle took place here long ago was probably between these two factions, and those that were lost in that fray have been risen over time and wander aimlessly through the streets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Free range undead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (airplane noise)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I called the airport to try and coordinate this time with you guys. Cost me 17,000 dollars for that one five-second bit, so enjoy it, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Worth it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Totally worth it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These bodies, compared to the ex-champion of the Raven Queen, do these bodies seem even older? More decayed? Do we have any sense for how old these fuckers are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have to get up close and that would be a medicine check. Would you want to try and make your way close enough to one of these bodies to inspect it enough?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far off are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys continue moving forward, you'll be at that intersection in about 30 seconds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not going to go. I'll wait.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could go up close with somebody and do a medicine check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep up near the thing. Everybody get close to the censer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll guide us towards something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, no one poking out ahead for this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hopefully they'll be affected by the censer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's just stop by.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who's moving forward?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The whole group. So we can all be with the wispy smoke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys make your way towards this intersection.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're normal people in robes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also watch as you begin to walk further in that elements of the ground are growing more jagged and craggy. You can see bits of stone and earth are jutting out in large stone spikes, either through some upheaval or elements of the tumultuous landscape long ago that just caused elements of rock to spike outward up five, ten feet in sections. You watch as you grow close to this intersection, about half of the group all at once (groan) turns and looks in your direction and begin to (footsteps).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I just waft some of the smoke towards them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shamble in your direction. The rest of the group noticing-- You begin blowing the censer smoke that way. You watch as three of the closest skeletons make their way into the fume and seem to vaguely lose interest for a brief moment.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Since we're close, can I do a medicine check? Are we close enough to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, but with disadvantage because of the smoke.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got this, Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll like it's a stealth roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the most you can really tell. They aren't fresh dead. These are long dead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm feeling Foresighty. Can I creep up behind and do the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say you can do that, however you still have disadvantage, because she's already taken the roll and you're supplementing her roll in a very short period of time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would that be an even roll, then, since I have advantage on everything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on everything. I'm giving you a chance to do this when normally you would have none, so the Foresight's allowing you to have a roll with disadvantage. Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's going to fail. Ooh! 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or not. Getting a glance at the one nearest to you, the bodies seem to be fairly well preserved for as long as they've been here, so you get the sense that there isn't a lot of heavy weather here at all. And given that fact, the decay that's there, it is reminiscent, maybe not quite as old as the corpse of Purvon when you discovered the tomb originally, but comparatively ancient. At least over 500 years.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Old Purvon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good old Purvon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These skeletons are almost as old as you, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue to walk forward, and the skeletons part around the cloud of the censer, you push deeper into the city, and they coalesce behind you and follow. They're keeping a perimeter cluster now. They're still being held at bay by the wafting of this thick blackish-green smoke that's billowing off of it, but they're staying just outside of it and slowly shambling at your speed, waiting for an opening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have an idea. What if, right when we get close to the tower, all of these trailing skeletons that we have on us, you just Turn Undead? And then you control them all?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Destroy them, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you can't control them? I thought you could.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could turn them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turn them means they just run away screaming.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can make them run away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're at a level where you can just make them explode if they roll low. Up to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got a little nuke in our pocket.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want us to be quiet. I don't want to make a big spectacle. Because I can make them go boom boom, but let's just wait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can make them poop.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And they don't even have bowels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is anything stalking us from above while we're moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How astute of you, I was just about to get to that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you hear that? Astute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You put the ass in astute.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, did you guys know that Travis is the smartest guy at the table?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. In the billowing smoke that's coming around, Grog, because you brought it up, as well as the twins who have relatively high passive perceptions, and Keyleth as well, actually, you glance up and notice that the erratic patterns that a lot of the gloom stalkers take in the sky, there's two that seem to be circling, and circling.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't like it, I don't like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them (shrieks), and you watch as it goes into a dive in your direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, God! In our direction?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a building we can duck into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a quick perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But quick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you, really quick, you see in two different directions, past the intersection on the right, and on the left, you see two buildings that are mostly still intact. They've sustained some level of damage, but they still have two solid floors, maybe a partial roof missing, but they appear to be structurally sound enough to at least jump into. They both have doors that are partially ajar and a darkened interior.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And a roof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a roof.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (grunting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (grunting) Why am I? I can talk. Go in that building.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we go in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That way they can't dive bomb us, at least.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I go in last. Censer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys all rush into the building on the right or the left?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the one that Vex found. You guys all rush into that building with Percival the last one in there. As you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Weapons drawn in case there's something in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But also moving like zombies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Perfect. So as you guys all rush into the building, weapons ready, who's first in the building?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me, maybe, because we saw it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you guys. Both of you roll perception as you enter the interior of the building. The undead that are clustering behind you are beginning to gather in a semicircle as soon as you hit the inside of the building, and they're clustering at the door as you close it behind you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you enter the inside, you look around and you can see what appears to be the remnants of a few tables, very simple tables, that have been shattered and destroyed, broken into ruin around the area. You see what appear to be blades, two left in the wall, one broken off, in the center, that have long rusted over time. You see what appear to be the signs of bodies, blood, dark, dark dried blood circles on the ground, but no corpses, no bodies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use the broken tables and swords to barricade the front windows or holes, I'm not sure which they are, but I'm going to barricade them. And the door, use the sword to jam the door shut.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there dark corners that anybody could be hiding in, or another room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The room itself is pretty damn dark. The little bit of light that comes in through the distant, broken elements of the wall, there's enough light where you can kind of-- it's very dim light for you, Percy. Everyone else with Darkvision is all right to make out the interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cursory trap check, even though it seems unlikely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No traps from what you can gather at this juncture. But you do hear, as you close the door and begin barricading it with Percival, you hear the multitudes of bony claws, hands, and bits of armor slamming and brushing up against the outer wall that you just came through. The doors (bang) as the undead have now clustered and are trying to push their way in. They seem to have a scent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll keep the censer near the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I do a little Gust cantrip and put a little of the censer smoke under the door. I'm like an oscillating fan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Druids get pretty cool at 18, guys. Just saying. Timeless body, oscillating fan. Best wild shape ability ever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait till you see the sprinkler system.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you're blowing the smoke from the censer beneath the doorway, it lessens the impacts, but the undead, more than a dozen or so of these, probably about 15 or 16 of them, have spread out, and they're all clustered at that side. The little bit of the fumes that you can push beneath the doorway are only reaching a handful, and it's keeping them from the main door at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we see outside at all? Is there a peephole or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are no windows at the front of this building. You see a sliver where it looks like a portion of the wall suffered some sort of an axe or hatchet impact a long time ago and someone tried to pull their way through. It's maybe about that wide, and that's where the one source of light is coming through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go over there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Don't do anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to say, what if we turned ourselves into something else and snuck out, and they would think that we're still in this building? Anything that was tracking us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was going to try to make a little diversion to draw them away from the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (boom) You guys hear a heavy impact on the roof above.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll do that. I'll do my thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear (boom) what sounds like really heavy footfalls along the roof of the building.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to look through the little sliver and I'm going to cast--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you want to see what they're burning in the censer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I do. That's exactly what I was going to do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to open up the censer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on, just a second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast Major Image and make a small little human girl in the middle of the street, crying, bleeding from the arm. She looks disoriented and she's walking towards the other building that we spotted, very sad and (whimpering).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you glance through and create this image, this image appears of this tiny, saucer-eyed French poppet of a girl with a little dress. Her curls are mussed up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dragging her dolly by one arm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's missing one button eye.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You summoned Cosette.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, basically. And she goes running off, screaming and crying. You guys immediately hear the shift of the undead beyond the door (rumbling) and begin getting fainter and fainter. As that happens, you also hear (whoosh). Scanlan, you glance out and you watch the shadow of one of the gloom stalkers flying overhead swoop down and attack for the little girl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, she's going to run. She's going to book it into that other building to try to get away as fast as she can. And she can move super fast since she's not real.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true. This is actually very true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's like the fucking Flash.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) There is a lady all in white...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 120 feet is all I can move her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's sweeping as she's running towards the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can make her move with an action 120 feet. So the little girl goes from (whimper) to (fast running) and goes into a full sprint in a really creepy, Ring-style way. That was for you, Travis. Across the way, and you watch as the gloom stalker swoops up and (impact) slams into the side of the stone building, causing part of it to crush inward and break. The roof partially (rumbling) has to settle and it falls into itself as the creature rights itself (shriek). You now have a much closer look at this entity, and it is billowing black shadow like smoke off of it. You can see glimpses of some sort of physical form in there, but it's so blurry, it's almost like it's phasing between physical matter and dream. You're not sure what it's made from, but you can see what looks to be an elongated neck, some sort of snapping jaw at the end, and two bright, greenish-yellow glowing beacons like eyes at the front of its face. Its wings don't have skin or flesh, it's just dark smoke, and as it flaps, it leaves these trails, these curling bits like black, black, black smoke.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we talking dragon size?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's wyvern sized. It's maybe 20 feet from wingtip to wingtip.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it anything like we've ever heard about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you have not encountered a creature like this before. But you watch as it glances, and at this proximity, Scanlan, you're the one who's getting the view of this, you watch wherever it looks, its eyes seem to emanate these tiny cones of light, like little flashlights, and as it scans past, the little girl, where the beam goes past, her body is nothing there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there another door in this building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is on the back side, yes. It's partially covered by what looks to be debris, and it looks like somebody else barricaded the other side, but did not seem to cover both ends before they fell within this building.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get out of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should go out the other door as fast as possible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take care of that barricade.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But quietly. We don't want them to know that we're getting out the other side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if I can guarantee that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Moving shit out of the way of the door, in a...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Medium pace?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's call it a medium well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are a terrible stage mom, by the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, she died.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She got her equity card.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's what matters. She's still there, and you watch, the creature seems confused. The eye beams move past it, and the little girl's still there crying and still darting around the area, and the creature's like (snarling), lands on the ground, and comes up and swipes and bites at her, and it goes through her form. You get the sense these creatures aren't super intelligent, but they are effective at seeing through certain glamors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're going to know that we're not. They know we're not zombies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it still after her, or has it given up on that ghost?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's in the process of giving up on that ghost right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still a cat and a flashlight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you watch as Grog goes over with his giant mitts and single-handedly shifts the entire pile over with one shove, exposing the door there before you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Out the door, out the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You open the doorway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we leave anything behind, like a dead body or something for them to eat?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What dead body?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's got a ton of them in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, yes. Throw a dead body in the room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's laughing now, bitches? Dead body!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And like the world's most macabre flower girl, you produce one of the...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I birth from the Bag of Holding a dead body.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And use Dust of Tracelessness as we run out the door, so they don't follow us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's giving the orders around here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me. Please?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you throw the body behind you, the door's now being slammed a bit. It seems some of the undead wandered towards that illusion, some are still on the other side, and now that you've pulled the censer back from it, the other door's kind of (bangs) coming pushed in. You can see light peeking through. You guys rush out, still with your Seeming illusion on, and you hear, very loudly, almost omnipresent, the screech, the (shriek) of the gloom stalker, right around the corner from you, as it begins to take off just on the other side of the building.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we look for another building we can duck into? To lose their-- So they can't find us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we can just go hopping from building to building.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want everyone to roll a stealth check, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we still have...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. You're getting close to the tail end of it. You have about five minutes left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank God we still have a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you add ten?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 22, I mean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did not roll well. But we're fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you all got above a 20. That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We needed above a 40.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys rush past and, quick glance around, you find one of the nearby buildings. It's a little more dilapidated, but it seems to have at least enough cover where you can all dive into the shadows and seemingly vanish. You all stand there for a second, and you're super quiet, all breathing heavily (panting), the censer still billowing this awful, awful fume. It's filling your nose, your eyes are watering instinctually from the presence. It stings just to get into your sinuses, but you're all enduring it and trying to be as quiet as possible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there another door in this building that we can exit out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm showing Keyleth what's inside the censer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, we'll get to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. It's hard to tell. It looks like where there may have been a door, a portion of the roof in here that has also collapsed, it looks like a giant siege stone, about that big, from a catapult was launched and tore through the roof and shattered that side of the building. The only way out is the same way you came in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not quite sure what it is or where it came from, but it's currently glowing red in places.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to give some of the herbs to Keyleth to examine. It's like on a charcoal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has what looks to be charcoal stones in the bottom clustered around, and these herbs are placed over it, and it's burning and smoldering over time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Can I tell what the herbs are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a medicine check. No, this would be a nature check, sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. Is this something that I would get advantage on for my herb book?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you would.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I get to look this up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, look it up. It's a real thing. Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's called Wild's Guide. It's a tobacco-like leaf that was used... It was briefly used for recreational smoking and treatment of small wounds, but it tended to have a very quick diseased, sickening sense to it. Those that smoked a lot tended to get sick very quickly, and it went into disuse from there. It's largely considered to be a relatively useless plant. There isn't a lot of medicinal quality to it. It's just something that exists in herbalism books, as things to avoid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Comes in green and red, available in the Resident Evil universe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that them using it for the censer is probably not a widely known use for this type of plant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You found a new use!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did! I write it down and I press a flower, or I save some of it. And then can I Druidcraft some more, now that I know what it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From that cluster, I'd say yeah, you can create a little bit more, but very little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'll go ahead and make as much as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you spend some time there to focus on it, and from the remnants there you can make about twice the amount than what was in the censer, so you have probably a good, solid softball-sized cluster.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The resin's the best part.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I take half, put half back in the censer, and give half to Percy. Does anybody else want some? Actually, should we dab ourselves with it? No, is that weird?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe just give it to Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really? After all that, no dab joke? Anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Too classy for us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever the opposite of standards are, I know we have them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give some to Percy, anybody else want some?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely in my shirt now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hunting from building to building. (impacts) Closer. (flapping wings) (snarling) A little further away. (flapping wings)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's gone? Did it fly away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sounds like it, at least.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we leave, and go to another building?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's keep going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Building to building toward the tower?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like it's not really gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we'll find out. Let's make a break for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, who's going first? Okay. Vax, as you dart along the side, glancing up in the air, you can still see. And it looks like there is some communication, because where once there was maybe two, you can now see a lot of them have clustered closer in your direction. There seems to be some sort of an overhead hunt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I cast Pass Without a Trace on us again? Are we running out of time on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're getting pretty close, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast it again, just so we don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you cast Pass Without a Trace again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And are we, Without a Trace and Dust of Tracelessness? That's just a one time...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dust of Tracelessness is just so they can't track us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the second thing you've gathered, these creatures are not very intelligent, but they do have some sort of communication between them, and there apparently is a rush on their end to search for whatever was recently spotted. So as you guys make your way, following Vax's lead, down some of the alleyways, and begin slithering through the back ways and the small side streets, avoiding your first attempt to walk straight through the center of the town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's crazy how that didn't work, though. I mean, because it was a really smart plan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It worked for a bit. Not every plan is going to hold you to the very end. There was some cleverness to it. So you begin to move through these buildings before-- It would be Keyleth, Vex and Vax. You guys come around one small alley and it opens up into another main road, and this road's hard to avoid. It seems to be almost a circular central road that marks the outer and inner rings of Thar Amphala. But you see there, marking right across this road, a 15 foot tall wall that seems to lock in the inner cloister of the town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How thick does it appear to be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can go under it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or through it. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell from this perspective. You have to get a better glance. You have to find if there was a break in the wall anywhere. You do see what looks to be some variation in texture a little ways to the right. It could be a gate, it could be a door, it could be an opening, or it could be some change in its rather solid, not very varied exterior.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go to the gate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just two seconds if it's the way to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it far away? It's like 15 feet from us you said? Is it farther than that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably about 60 feet down to the right of you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the change in the wall's about 60 feet, but the wall from our hiding spot is how far away from us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: it's only about 15 feet tall, it's not crazy big.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll see if I can discern something here a little bit better. You go. Go check it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Above it, just above it, about eight feet up, you see what appears to be a deep cerulean blue gemstone, about two feet across, that's embedded within the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just go through the hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're good. We found it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a big blue stone, about that big around. It's embedded into the wall above the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I ask them, how thick does the wall appear to be around that side?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looking through the door, can we tell how deep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, actually, you can. It's about three feet wide, four feet wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The depth of the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The depth of the wall, yeah. It's a big, heavy wall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vex, I bet if you go real fast, you can totally make it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good idea, Grog. I'll definitely try it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can try and Stone Shape through it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two... recognize, at least, there's something very familiar about that stone embedded in the wall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's blue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's definitely blue. It's very similar in size, installation, and functional placement as the threshold crests that adorn the exterior of Syngorn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which are definitely used... Wait. To teleport things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones that are used to transport Syngorn to the Feywild and back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, weird. Oh no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to stop this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we dismantle the gems?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would probably have to dismantle a bunch of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're out in the open. Dismantling that's pretty tough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like it would be easier to wreck the operator than try to break the machine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, we've got a guy who crushes rocks all the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but I don't think it's safe to touch those things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the moment he makes a ruckus, the air squad is coming down on our location immediately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we take some of that crystal? Didn't we take some of that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which crystal?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we take shards of it from the thresholds in Syngorn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember. I don't have any in my bag.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One of them shattered, and I feel like we took some.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, shards of blue crystal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Matt's like, uh...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, maybe it's useful in this case?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not pretty, it's all broken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One question is, if these stones are used to pull this tower into the main realms, is there another purpose to them here, or is that doorway safe, is what I'm wondering?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that doorway is in no way safe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where was the gem embedded in the doorway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About eight feet up. About two feet above the doorway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like we should go through the wall or over it, just on principle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can go over it. We do have a magic carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and all the flying creatures are going to see us immediately. We either go under the wall... How far from the wall to the tower is it? Does it seem?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see the tower through the doorway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see across, and it's not a straight shot, but you can get low and you can see where it breaks. Since you have a good sense of direction, being the ranger, I'd say you know it's at least under a mile.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A mile to the tower? So it's probably two miles wide, this whole...?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably less. It's hard to pinpoint directly from what little you can see, but it's definitely within a mile to a half mile of that door, that wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kiki, would you be able to Great Escape us underneath this wall?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I'm thinking. What if we go under the ground all the way to the tower?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it unworked stone? What's the ground like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ground is unworked stone. It is broken dirt and earth and stone. From what you gather, at the very least. A heavy layer of dust.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the likelihood that we might encounter, that I might bust through a dungeon or something, though, over there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be the question. It's A, where do we come up? B, how do we tunnel without collapsing a building on us? And C, what if there's buried dead that haven't been able to break?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get us under the wall for sure. I can do both, it's just figuring out what we want to do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can tunnel under the wall and then come up in a building.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think so. We're not trying to get all the way there, just past this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Can I Stone Shape--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From within a building.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- a crawlspace through the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can probably do that. Let me look at the Stone Shape spell here real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Big enough for at least Grog to marine belly through?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all undead, so I'm a little smaller right now, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you look smaller.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You look smaller than you are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still your same height.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You would be a little zombie, floating, stuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we be zombie cows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stone Shape is instantaneous, and it's a section no more than five feet in any dimension, so Stone Shape would be just a one-hit boom. You could not create a long tunnel.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I can't carve a shape through the wall to just crawl through, five feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, through the actual wall itself?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, through the wall, not under the ground. I want to bust a crawl space through the bottom of the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you think the flying guys will notice that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that could work. So do you want to do that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a dynamite blast, it's like a (rumble).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's just a hole in the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like butter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's like butter. So...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you dart across the open road to the other side, where the wall is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cover for me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How would we do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are stealthed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I-- Shit, well, you already rolled. Can I have been keeping an eye on the sky and give her a go ahead when it looks like they're not going to see her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to do so as she runs across the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just go. Just fucking go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the distant shrieks, communication between the various gloom stalkers that (snarling) echoing in the sky. You make it all the way across to the wall, and get low, focus, close your eyes, press your hand against the cold, dark wall, and feel it (whoosh) as immediately, you carve a circular tunnel through that goes completely to the other side. Seemingly to no negative effect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seemingly to no negative effect, I've made a tunnel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You sound different. Why are you using weird words?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm whispering! I'm just trying to be more pragmatic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, guys, we didn't eat a Heroes' Feast yet, either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We didn't heal ourselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we didn't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got to get through the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get through the wall, and then we'll heal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He is looking at each one of us and rolling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's making eye contact and rolling a die, like it means something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not going to look at him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keeping track. Why is he keeping track?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I don't look, he can't kill me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If you don't make eye contact.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like in school, if you don't make eye contact, maybe they won't call on you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's the old Warner Brothers rule. So as you guys all, one by one, dart across and leap beneath the tunnel that Keyleth had created, Keyleth, have you gone through the tunnel, or are you seeing everyone else through?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll wait and see everyone else through, just in case.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, how generous of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We all are dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all begin darting through, one after another.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to try and keep a lookout.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you glance up as, at the very tail end of it, you have Scanlan and Pike at the very end, ready to rush through the tunnel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're slow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you guys doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hurrying.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jumping through as fast as our little gnome feet can take us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Pike, you dart through, Scanlan, you dart through. With the size of the tunnel, it's easy enough for the both of you to just run through while crouching as opposed to having to get on your hands and knees, so you guys start making your way through to the side. Pike, you make it out the other side. Scanlan, you're halfway through. Keyleth, you're still there, ready to go in after as it's about to bear down on you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not coming up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, no, it's going for a straight dive. It's going right for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, god, am I trying to do anything but get through?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're running! Come on!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She has to duck down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, I've got to crawl through!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. So do you have protection? Do you have something you could turn into?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Thank you! Thank you! I'm going to see it and immediately Beast Shape into a little mouse and (crawling sounds) through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want you to roll an initiative roll to see whether or not it gets to you in time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I rolling, too, since I'm half-out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're halfway in the tunnel. It couldn't fit in the tunnel if it wanted to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But, I mean, am I watching this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're watching this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to roll. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to say that I didn't leave the other side of the wall when I realized that she wasn't coming through. So, waiting right in front of Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Natural 19 plus three. So, as you shift down into the tiny mouse-like form, its claws immediately slam into and sink into the mouse body. Yeah, that's a 23 to hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Immediately poof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much hit points does your mouse form have? Like one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming no more than a kitten's worth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 15 points of piercing damage, Keyleth, and you are grappled.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool. Cool. Cool. Cool story. Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as it grabs you, it begins to pull you out of the tunnel and lift with you in its claws.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I grab her arms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan's on the other side right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm three feet away from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but he's in front of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone else on the other side of the wall, Scanlan in the middle, Keyleth in the front. You saw it shriek and dive down, you don't know what happened from that point. You can glance down and you watch as Keyleth is being pulled up. You see that happening. Scanlan, what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll yell to the rest: it's got Keyleth. I'll cast Dominate Monster on it, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, what's the spell DC on that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I was probably not fast enough to pull up my horn, so 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a natural four plus three. So, as you say that and turn around, you bring your hand up and begin muttering the incantation and finish it with a

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could have just done that this whole time?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you finish the incantation, you watch as a small ring of glowing purple-pink glyphs appear like a crown around the outside, floating about three inches from the gloom stalker's "head." Its shriek goes (intense to calm croaking) and it's just there, hovering in the air, about ten feet up, clutching Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Please deposit her on the other side. Over the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take five points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (wheezing) You could have told it gently!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't speak Gloom!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five points?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You (wham) and almost knocks the wind out of you, and you slam into the hard ground, but the claws unfurl and leave you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (wheezing) I made it, guys! I'm glad you made it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only 59 more minutes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe he can tell the others to leave us alone!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, call them off!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or maybe there are birds on the other side of the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does he keep rerolling for breaking, or is that it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell them it's handled, we're dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then we can ride him!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ask him if he has any money, and ask him if he can make a good dinner because I'm hungry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's the nearest 7-11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each time the target takes damage. It has to take damage to get the save. So, it's under your control for an hour or until it takes damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No more flesh down here. And come back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the heavy clusters that had been swarming this area of the town begin to respond in kind. You hear the echoes, the cacophony of various screeches and screams and they all begin to slowly dissipate and diffuse amongst the entire city of Thar Amphala.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that went well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome back, Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's good to be back. Okay, we'll need a name for him, obviously.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, anybody got any ideas?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Benjamin is what I'm thinking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Benjamin is great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mr. Mistoffelees!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we ride him to the tower?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, some of us can, right? By looking at him, how much can he carry? Or she!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not certain, based on its size, it could maybe carry three medium to small people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispered) What's around us right now? (regular volume) Sorry, what's around us right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you are glancing up, too, you see the flicker, the faint flicker of the conjoining strands of magical energy that are rising up to the pinnacle of the tower of Entropis where you see these three heavy claw-like fingers that jut out of the top of the tower all curve inward. The flash is in the center of it, it's just glowing brighter and brighter. That pulsing is (pulsing). It's almost like seeing this heartbeat of pure energy that's swelling and swelling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think we have time to stop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, so no more healing. But we could fly right up there and break that thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we really not want to do any other healing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no time for a rest. No time for a Heroes' Feast. I bought those

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Next time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might still be useful.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How long does Heroes' Feast take?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like an hour or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It will hardly matter.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We can't just take an hour?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that thing is like, going to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you guys. It's a gradual. It's not like all of a sudden, right now, you watched it pulse. As you've been getting towards, you've been watching it slowly swell. So, who knows.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some of us could get on Mr. Mistoffelees and fly around the tower and see if there's a window that we could bust in or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if Delilah's on the top of the tower.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but we'll be on a thing, so maybe we won't be very conspicuous.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mistoffelees-- I'm going to never get tired of saying that!-- to go up to the tower, greet whoever's up there, and throw them off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just a pulsing orb of doom, isn't it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just go up there and cause havoc.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One of us needs to see what's up there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we can just send him up there, and then we can head in through the tower. He can just be a problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's dumb! What if comes back and he's like 'I don't know!'?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just say, go up there and if there's anything living up there, throw it off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can't one of us go up there with him to scout it out? Yeah, if someone's invisible. Can't you all be invisible?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, all of us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, it's just you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't you make all of us invisible?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mistoffelees! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we head in closer on foot. If you want to ride Mr. Mistoffelees up to the top of the tower, that's one thing. But I think just sending him up there, or sending him to be an agent of chaos.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could probably ride him, and if shit goes south, I could get away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could always get swallowed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By Mr. Mistoffelees?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get the distinct impression we're going to have options before this day is over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we're going to have to do a lot of things to stop this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to get into the tower! We don't even know how to do that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know what we're talking about, which is why I think the idea to go scope it out is a good one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like there's any windows on the tower, or is just a big old Rapunzel tower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, hold on. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a solid tower.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are there any doors? No windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't tell from your perspective right now. The base is currently obscured by the very, very dense buildings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ultimate challenge for Vox Machina.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we check one of the buildings, and then we can figure out who wants to go check it out, so we can get out of the open?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's get in a building and hide!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because he's a cleaner!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The tower, is it obscured by all this shit happening on top of it? Vex can see there's no windows; can we see if there's a rooftop to it at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a top to the tower.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it this, is it this, or can we not see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tower gently tapers and then comes to an end. There is a top. You see there's three giant, curled finger-like black spires that curl inward on the outside, inward. And then there's the platform where the tower stops, where it seems like there would be somewhere to stand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The thing that's glowing is off of the ground of the tower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's filling up the entirety of that space between the fingers on the actual roof of the tower.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if it has to keep expanding all the way to the crystals?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the nearest building? Is there one building that's closest to where we came through the tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys are about ten feet from the nearest building.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk over? Are there any windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This building does not have any windows.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it have a door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I knock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, come here! And I grab his face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muffled yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Inside! Inside!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We just go in. Push in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we're going in now, aren't we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we're walking, and we're walking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll tell Mr. Mistoffelees to do a 90-second loop and come back down and check in on us because he can't fit in the door, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fly around 90 seconds and swoop back down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does a small circle as you guys all rush into the building. You enter the inside. You see what looks to be a lot of building materials. It looks like some of the outer buildings here were used as the storage facilities for what a lot of the city was rebuilt as. There's nobody else inside right now. This gentleman looks like he was on his way out of the building as you interrupted him. As now most of his head is just clasped by your giant goliath Titanstone Knuckle-adorned hand, you see a little bit of his eye peeking over Grog's, and he's like (muffled yelling).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see he's got the heavy male pattern-- looks like the old D&D Dungeon Master from the cartoon. He's bald on top, has long gray hair that goes past his shoulders. Very thin, missing the left eye, and he's just limp. He's not even going to fight it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh hey! We were sent here by Delilah Briarwood. You may know her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muffled yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. The ritual that's happening on top of the tower. How long until that thing's done?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muffled noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Blink once for 15 minutes. Blink twice for an hour or more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three times for a bunch of days.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe he doesn't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, do you know? Blink once for yes, blink twice for no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muffling noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15 minutes! No, that was once for 15 minutes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that was an hour, at least!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he blinked before. Are we at an hour and 15 minutes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's just a wink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A wink? Man, semantics!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that, as you say that, it does hurt him a little. His demeanor, while already pretty shattered, just even further (sad noise).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does he have any pouches on him, or anything in his hands?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's just adorned in regular--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is the sack on the ground now or is it still over his shoulder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's currently on the ground. He dropped it as soon as you rushed and pushed him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take the satchel, and I give it to Pike and say: look in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance inside. As soon as you grab it, you hear the clanging of metal. You look inside and you can see what appear to be a handful of dark metal shortswords, daggers, simple dried rations, and, in fact, as you glance inside the room now, you can see a lot of the supplies here, aside from construction supplies, you see a handful of weapons that are well-made, recent-made, not seen battle yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're about to invade.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we burn the fucking city down?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, sure! What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, if they're planning on transporting this whole fucking city, and setting an army loose on our world, why don't we just burn the whole fucking city down? Destroy their rations. Destroy their weapons!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am excited by this plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what? No! That's terrible!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's burn down Manhattan. How do you do that?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obviously, you're like really cool with the purpose-- perspective of dying, and I'll quicken that if you make a loud noise. Right, like, if you've ever seen, like, Jello mixed with, like apple pudding. That's what I'll do to your head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did your hand signal for Arnold Palmer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Universal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Arnold Palmer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. He doesn't make a sound, more than the gentle trickle out of his pant leg does. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Grab the scruff of his collar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you release, he (gasps). His teeth are broken and yellow, his one gaping socket is twitching a little bit from the recovery of the sudden, rapid series of events that he was not expecting today. As he gathers his breath, and scratches the side of his leg, "So. What do you wish to do to me?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing! We've got to hurry!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, really, do you know anything about the ritual?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, not the specifics."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know if it's going to be over soon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know that some of the acolytes were rushing through, expediting things recently."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did they tell you to gather weapons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They just told us to be ready."

lines.name: LIAM
